Even Battlefield 2042 had better ratings at launch

I only installed and "played" this on Steam so I could leave a review. Started up the game and literally forgot it was running in the background which is the only reason I have more than 0.1 hours "played".

Overwatch 1 was fun and all for a while even though they were constantly re-using their events. Blizzard had an excuse to no longer release proper updates with new heroes, maps, etc. because they claimed they were working hard on Overwatch 2 because it would be mainly focused on PvE which was their priority. 

Let's fast forward to right now, what did we get? They cancelled the promised PvE mode, yes, now there are PvE missions which will be released in batches of 3 that you will have to pay 15 dollars for every time and won't be anything close to the PvE content they promised. The game is no longer 6v6, they turned it into 5v5, might not sound like a big deal but it really made a difference in gameplay experience. No more lootboxes that you earn by levelling up for free skins, sprays, etc. instead there is a shop. The prices for the skins alone, including the ones from Overwatch 1 which people earned for free are 20 dollars, not to mention skins and what not that are locked behind bundles. They even got greedy with their fucking Twitch drops which now give you 5 battle pass levels. Overwatch 2 heroes are locked behind the battle pass, you either gotta pay for it, or have to play this game enough to unlock the new hero for the on-going season which is a demonic sacrifice on its own.
Are you new to Overwatch 2 and want to play as heroes from Overwatch 1 which everyone got absolutely free? Or maybe you missed out on some heroes from previous seasons? Don't worry, you can buy the Complete Hero Collection for 20 dollars.

This game is literally just a worse version of Overwatch 1 with a 2 on the logo, more micro-transactions, a few new heroes and maps, and yes, still the exact same events from Overwatch 1. Junkenstein's Revenge is back of course, not even with a new map. It's exact same map but you get to play in a different area.

Do yourself a big favor, save your money, don't give it to Blizzard and play an actual fun game instead of this boring, stale, piece of shit god forsaken disaster of a cash grab. Wake up, Blizzard. You guys should be absolutely ashamed of yourselves.

If any other devs see this review, take a good look at Overwatch 2. There's no better game in existence to show you how to kill your game.

What are you doing reading the positive reviews? dont install this game.

[h1]Preface[/h1]

I bought multiple copies of Overwatch 1 at launch for my brother and friends who couldn't afford it and I played it for 1000 hours. It has been my go-to game to pass time since its original release until I dropped it after the final nail in the coffin which was the announcement of the PvE being cancelled. I wasn't even that excited about PvE to begin with, but this was the major component that justified the content drought in OW1 and the 2 in OW2.

Below is a list of reasons that made me quit Overwatch indefinitely.

[h1]Monetization[/h1]
[list]
[*] Their value proposition is completely messed up. They are not even coherent with themselves. Most skins that are not recolours cost 20â‚¬ or more. For the price of two legendary skins, you could buy the original Overwatch 1 or plenty of AA or indie games that you could enjoy for tens or hundreds of hours. Let that sink in people. No consumer in their right mind and who has self-respect should buy these things.
[*] Overwatch 1 Loot Boxes (earn via gameplay at the rate of 1-2 minimum per gameplay session) > Overwatch 2 Battle Pass (10â‚¬ each season)
[*] 15â‚¬ for 3 PvE missions (1h30~ gameplay of archieve missions v1.02)
[/list]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
[list]
[*] [b]5v5:[/b] Removing a tank from the equation removed a lot of synergies for tanks, and placed a huge burden on this role. You just cannot play the game if your tank dies and a lot of tanks don't even feel like tanks, they are supposed to dive into enemy lines leaving the team defenseless. Having the worse tank is pretty much a guaranteed loss. To compensate for the removal of a tank they made tanks superheroes that are extremely tanky and can annihilate whole teams with their ults.
[*] [b]Player Balance:[/b] No balance whatsoever in Quick Play and all ranks are super inflated in Ranked so you end up seeing people in lobbies that do not belong (low elo players in high elo lobbies or vice versa).
[*] [b]Hero Balance:[/b] Every other week they (over)buff a new tank which becomes the meta and dominates every game making any other picks pretty much "troll"
[*] [b]Progression Systems:[/b] They removed pretty much all progression systems; levels, unlockables
[*] [b]Mechanics:[/b] They removed: On fire, cards, and voting system at the end of the game
[/list]

[h1] What they did to Overwatch[/h1]
[list]
[*] They let Overwatch 1 rot by investing all dev into OW2 which is in my honest opinion unworthy of being called a sequel
[*] They decommissioned Overwatch 1 which people bought and replaced it with its downgraded successor
[*] They squandered what Overwatch could have been for a cash shop "upgrade"
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1] 

I left Overwatch with a heavy heart because deep down, I still like the gameplay, characters, and the universe. I urge all gamers to take a stand for the games they used to or still love and stop apologizing for every bad decision that companies make to satisfy their shareholders. If you bought Overwatch 1, if you used to or still do like Overwatch and think that it deserved better as a franchise, be a better consumer, have some more self-respect, and if you think "No, the state of the game and the direction it has taken are not OK", for the love of god, make yourself heard with your wallet and your playtime.

Thank you.

If you want to play this game it's a good time killer, but if you're looking for a quality PvE experience, Deep Rock Galactic is so much better. Don't ever get hyped about anything because it will be delivered with the least amount of effort possible, and then they just pretend it revolutionized gaming. Not a damn thing as lived up to the hype since Rammattra's release and even that's debatable. 

Play Deep Rock instead.

They've moved from molesting their employees to molesting my wallet.

There's some shit I'm pissed off about, like Lifeweavers place-ables being red on both teams and Bastion makes more sense as a tank than Doomfist but...

The real thing is going from 6v6 to 5v5 changed everything. The game flow, the balance, the amount of the map that can actually be used without screwing over the rest of your team. I've never really played Overwatch 2 because I wanted to play Overwatch 2. I play it because I want to play Overwatch, and that game is gone. Forever.

If you haven't played Overwatch 1, you never will. It appears great efforts were taken to make sure this game isn't that one.

P.S. The old scoreboard or something like it (Just my stats and primarily both team comps front and center.) didn't need to be removed entirely, you could have both.  

Oh, and to all the chicken shit tryhards who couldn't handle 2 Capture Point.  "I miss Paris."

This game has taken over 10,000 hours of my life, and at least most of that was competing in what i used to consider the "highest rank" of play. I've scrimmed, i've played in tournaments and ive grinded ladder. I spent months learning new heroes just because i "had" to play them in scrims, thats how dedicated i was to overwatch

i spent two years suffering through double shield, during all that my excuse for blizzards shitty balancing was the fact their main focus was on pve. That was always the excuse, the reason we got rehashed events? PVE. The reason we don't get many new heroes? PVE. I let myself be fooled into believing ow2 would be the breath of freshair. I suffered through 2019, 2020 overwatch because i had hope. When the beta for ow2 released, there was hardly any hero balance changes, and those that existed felt like the dev team had a week to think of ideas to make 5v5 work and threw them in. What was the excuse we gave? The focus was still on pve. 

And then they cancelled it :) What happened to the four years of work blizzard. We got three missions and you expect us to pay for it? and to TRUST you?
They should add Brigitte 2 so that she can hard counter the nose-dive this game took after 2017
